titleproper.value: Guide to the Joseph and Leo Gordon Papers <num>ALBA.133</num>

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace
        <date>2017-08-09T14:22:45</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

abstract.value:
Joseph Gordon (1914-1942) and Leo
        Gordon (1915-1938), brothers raised in Brooklyn, New York, joined the International Brigades
        in Spain in 1936 and 1937, respectively. Leo was killed in action. Joe later joined the
        Merchant Marines and was killed when his ship was torpedoed in the North Atlantic. The
        collection is primarily comprised of letters from Leo and Joe during their time in Spain, as
        well as letters written while they were traveling and working odd jobs around the U.S. in
        the early 1930s.

p.value:
Materials are open to researchers. Please contact the Tamiment Library & Robert F.
        Wagner Labor Archives for more information and to schedule an appointment,
        tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu or 212-998-2630.

Published citations should take the following form: <lb/><lb/>Identification of item, date;
        Collection name; Collection number; box number; folder number; <lb/>Tamiment Library/Robert
        F. Wagner Labor Archives <lb/>Elmer Holmes Bobst Library <lb/>70 Washington Square South
        <lb/>New York, NY 10012, New York University Libraries.

<list>
          <item>Daniel Czitrom, Introduction, "Volunteers for Liberty: Letters from Joe and Leo
            Gordon, Americans in Spain, 1937-38," in Massachusetts Review 25 (Fall 1984).</item>
        </list>

Letters addressed to "Gus" are to Gussie Moskowitz, a cousin of the Gordons who worked in
        the garment industry and was involved in activist politics. In some letters Leo refers to
        Joe by his nickname, "Chosie."

corpname.value:
Spain. Ejercito Popular de la Republica. MacKenzie-Papineau
        Battalion
